text: Let's try another scenario, going shopping at the market.
How would you ask the stallholder if they can help you?
Literally, how would you say, can you help me? Can you aid me?
Pouvez-vous m'aider?
The stallholder asks you, what is it that you desire? What is it that you want?
Qu'est-ce que vous désirez?
Ask the stallholder, say, do you have some cheese? Is it that you have some cheese?
Est-ce que vous avez du fromage?
The stallholder says yes. How will he say that?
Oui.
Say to him, I would like 200 grams of brie.
Je voudrais 200 grams de brie.
Then ask him if he has a bag. Simply say, you have a bag?
Vous avez un sac?
He gives you the sac and asks you, is that all? How would he say that? It's all? That's all?
C'est tout?
Reply, yes, that's all. It's how much?
Oui, c'est tout. C'est combien?
He tells you it's 10 euros. How will he say that?
10 euros.
You then go on to a second stall.
This time the stallholder comes up to you and says,
Can I help you? Literally saying, I can help you?
Je peux vous aider?
Say, I would like a baguette, please.
Je voudrais une baguette, s'il vous plaît.
He says, there you are, there you go, voilà, that's all.
Voilà, c'est tout?
Say, no, I would like an éclair.
Non, je voudrais un éclair.
He replies, I'm sorry, I'm desolated.
We don't have any.
Je suis désolé, nous n'en avons pas.
Say, oh, OK, oh, well, it's how much?
Ah bon, c'est combien?
Two euros.
Deux euros.
Deux euros.
Thank you.
